intro: Justicia pseudospicata, commonly known as the spiked false dragonhead, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of 30 to 60 centimeters. Its foliage consists of opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Justicia pseudospicata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
